snippet: The thumping nature of Mitt Romney’s victory in Florida has reinforced the belief of President Obama’s advisers that he will be the choice.
abstract: Mitt Romney's strong victory in the Florida primary has reinforced beliefs among Pres Obama's advisers that he will be the Republican nominee; Obama professes to be governing rather than campaigning, but he has woven an increasing number of oblique attacks against Romney into recent speeches.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Falls Church, Va., and Michael D. Shear from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The thumping nature of Mitt Romney’s victory in Florida has reinforced the belief of President Obama’s advisers that he will be the choice.

headline.seo: Obama’s Words Hint at Romney as Expected Rival
headline.main: Obama’s Oblique Attacks Hint at Romney as Expected Rival
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Oblique Attacks Hint at Romney as Expected Rival
